intro: Staurostigma odorum, commonly known as the fragrant star-stem, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, sweet-smelling aroma that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its growth is slow, and it thrives in shaded, moist environments with well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and unique botanical features, Staurostigma odorum is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
